page.title: 08Hobbies on Horse-Eye Level
page.content: Horse-Eye Level is close to Hailsham & Eastbourne and is visited by people from these towns for recreation. The many dykes and rivers used for fishing by Hailshams Memorial Institute and Angling Club are by permit only. The main fish caught are Roach, Perch and Rud. The Pevensey Marsh Beagles sometimes stray into the area but it is not their main course. The massive variety of wildlife and flora attract nature lovers from all over the county. Local Rambling Clubs visit the area & use the many footpaths. Sadly, often signposts indicating footpaths have disappeared, possibly through lack of use at some time and some have even been fenced over. This may indicate a lack of interest of public right of way across land or an attempt by landowners to deter the public from walking across their land.
